column4: tom i also need network/torrent related advice, if somebody could tell us where we could go to find out
whatever client you use, the Azureus wiki has good torrent info
im using two clients and have the same result which is that my upload speeds are zero altough my ports are open according to firestarter
do you know another room where i might be able to get help?
I assume your ports are properly forwarded etc. Does your ISP do evil things with bit torrent ?
not that i know because i was getting excellent speeds on windows with azureus
the only thing is that im not sure if i forwarded my ports correctly in linux, im using firestarter and im asuuming that opening the ports through firestarter is good enough
are you using UPNP ? I have found that manual port forwarding works best
you need to make sure the ports are forwarded from your router
no upnp is turned off in both clients, it has to be something in linux because its the same problem with two different torrent clients
if your port forwarding is wrong, nothing will work, of course :)
if you trun the firewall off ( clear iptables), does it work?
how do i clear iptables
might be best to just turn the firewall off through firestarter
if you aren't familiar with iptables
yeah im still a linux newbie and because of that am not yet familiar with iptables
sure - just use the firatarter front end GUI then
ok turning it off isnt doing anything unfortutanetly for either client
my download speeds are also not up to par but ill worry about that later. right now the thing thats bothering me is that my upload is not going at all
if you are not uploading at all then it is almost certainly a port forwarding issue
yeah  well my router is set up as an accesspoint with NAT disabled and i therefore cant set up portfowarding on the router, could that be the problem
yes :)
